brief_summary.textblock:
Untreated ulnar styloid fracture may affect the outcomes of distal radial fracture patient
      treated with external fixation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Ulnar Styloid Fracture on the Outcome of Distal Radial Fractures Treated With External Fixation
condition: Fracture of Distal End of Radius

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  unstable distal radial fracture

          -  fixed with external fixator

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  multiple fracture

          -  open fracture

          -  nerve injury

          -  vascular injury

study_pop.textblock:
unstable distal radial fracture patients: (1) the initial dorsal angulation ＞20°, (2) with
        dorsal or volar comminution of the metaphysis, (3) shortening of radius ＞5 mm, and (4)
        with an associated ulnar fracture.

facility.name: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

primary_outcome.description: extension, flexion, radial deviation, ulnar deviation, forearm pronation and forearm supination
presence of ulnar-sided wrist pain during daily activities was recorded

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

secondary_outcome.description: Standard anterior-posterior and lateral radiographs were obtained at each time point to evaluate fracture healing and the alignment of the distal part of the radius. Radial inclination, volar tilt, and radial height were measured

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
